channel.title: Vb.net help
channel.description:
Ok I need help with vb.net
I have 10 buttons and have a sub that handles all of them. I also have 10 seperate labels. I want to make it so that when a button is clicked, one RANDOM label is no longer visible.
Any ideas? I used the rnd() function but I cant seem to make it select a random label and make visible = false.
Thanks.

item.title: Vb.net help
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

the array idea is best, set a min and max rand value, (i.e. 0-10 or however many labels you have) and your sorted

Read full topic

item.title: Vb.net help
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well i program in VB .NET but i never went into randoms, first I would sugest a case switch where a random number will follow this code because it isn’t like label & “1”.enabled = false type of thing here.

Read full topic

item.title: Vb.net help
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

I don’t really use VB.net, but you could make an array of the labels, then the rnd() function could be used to assign an index of the function to hide?

Read full topic
